page.title: 18POPULATION
page.content: With an approx.area of 2,lOO acres Maghull is bound by Sefton to the west and Melling to the East, Lydiate to the North and Aintree to the South. At the l98l census the estimated population was 24,5OO but the trend appears to be a fluctuating one as labour leaves and arrives in the area. Since the end of the last war new residential developments in the town have added to the amenities whilst at the same time the town has retained its semi-rural atmosphere. Maghull continues to preserve its individual life as a small but thriving community, attributed largely to the comprehensive range of clubs and societies etc. which allow residents to pursue their interests without recourse to the city's facilities.
